search_parameters.q: The Split Labor Market and Ethnic Antagonism: A Case Study in Higher Education. Jacques, Jeffrey M. Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: The Split Labor Market and Ethnic Antagonism: A Case Study in Higher Education. Jacques, Jeffrey M. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: The split labor market and ethnic antagonism: A case study in higher education
organic_results.snippet: Using Dahrendorf's theoretical construct of authority structure and relations and Bonacich's theoretical construct of the split labor market along ethnic lines producing ethnic antagonism, an historically black university was examined. Some of the reasons for white self-selection into this milieu are postulated along with the motives for recruitment of whites by administrators of this university. The relative status of whites vis-a-vis blacks is analyzed, using bivariate and multivariate techniques, in terms of authority positions, rank, salary, and …

publication_info.summary: JM Jacques - Sociology of Education, 1980 - JSTOR
